scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending four certificates to be signed by Dr. Franklin.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks him to tell Madame Helvétius that "one coach full of Alexanders will wait on her Wednesday". The postponed St. Germain ball will be on Thursday.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lends his horse with great pleasure and wishes to borrow his carriage to take Amantiné, the Italian singer, from Paris to Auteuil and back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Apologizes for not writing; has not forgotten all his kindnesses.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks for a passport for Peter Fowler who is to take a letter to Mr. [William] Hodgson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: As his sword is broken he asks for the loan of one of William Temple Franklin's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invites him and his grandfather to dinner to meet Mr. [Thomas] Walpole and his son.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expects him for dinner; wishes to borrow two bottles of claret and one of sherry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses Mr. [Samuel] Wharton's bill with his receipt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a letter to Mr. [John] Penn, now in Paris; [Capt. Joshua] Barney went to sea on the 17th; asks for news of the cartel; if the vessel does not arrive soon, the British will have to be sent to Dinan, then the commander of the cartel will go to St. Malo; let him know any important news as quickly as possible; can save the United States much money since there is a considerable difference between peace and war freights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting him to remind his Grandfather of his promise to come and take tea with her and play a game of chess.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wishes to know what sized paper Franklin wants.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has received a case for him.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing Mr. [William] Rawle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bill for £180 has been placed to Mr. Hodgson's credit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks that the bills, if accepted, be returned.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves, marquis de, 1757-1834

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking him to receive M. de Sai[l]ly and assist him with his device; intends giving M. de Sai[l]ly letters of recommendation to America.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends two copies of his book, one for him, the other for the illustrious Mr. [Benjamin] Franklin.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires when the "Washington" sails, as he wishes to send some letters to America.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to dinner for Dr. Franklin and himself.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting him to their house at St. Germain.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will not be able to leave Paris as every place was taken, therefore returns Mr. [Jonathan] Williams, [Jr.]'s letter; asks permission to make another copy of Benjamin Franklin's picture. Mr. [Caleb] Whitefoord took the last one he made.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends letter referred to by Dr. Ingen Housz; is much displeased at the latter's distrust of his veracity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of his sympathy and support of the American cause in Ireland; showed it on several occasions; appeared in deep mourning in the Irish Parliament on the death of Gen. [Richard] Montgomery. Balked the attempt of the British Government to secure an address of support from the citizens of Dublin during the war; the people overwhelmingly opposed to it. The British Government feared to draft many troops out of Ireland; only 2,000 out of the 13,000 troops in Ireland were sent to America. Predicts a great future for the United States. Recommends two of his friends for appointment as Consular Agents. Recalls the address of Congress to the people of Ireland signed in August, 1775, and forwarded to him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will take all the necessary steps to billet the British prisoners in France. Proposes to send back the American prisoners to America in a cartel. Is superintending the loading of public goods and supplies for America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a list of the prisoners taken by the "Buccaneer" and the "Revolution," which they suppose will be the last they shall have the pleasure of sending, being told that the preliminaries for a general peace are signed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiring about a bill of F[rancis] Hopkinson on the United States Commissioners, in favor of John Sparhawk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Repaying 10 louis loaned to Capt. [Daniel] McNeill by William Temple Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is a son of the late Gen. Barrington and served for a time as an ensign in the 3d Regiment of Foot Guards. Has severed his connection with the English army and is living with his mother in France. Wishes to obtain employment in the United States army and offers his services.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Everyone in a state of suspense as to whether there is to be peace or war. Asks to be given a hint in time. Applies for commissions for two brigs owned by him and Sam[uel] White.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hopes he will be chosen to execute a statue of Dr. Franklin, or some monument to commemorate the signing of peace between England and the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Renews his request for commissions or passports for two brigs, the "Olive" and the " Hetty." Current report that a general peace was signed on the 19th.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiring about the freighting of a ship, the " Weeren firenden," at l'orient by the Minister of Marine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to shipment by him of public supplies to America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing his friend, [Major] Samuel White.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanking him for sending his "little American almanac" to the United States. Is going to publish a second edition.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Refers to Mlles, Brillon and comments sarcastically on the accident to the Duke de Chartres. Tells of his stag and fox hunts.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing M. Michel, of Beauvais.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has learned from Mr. [Robert R.] Livingston and Mr. [Robert] Morris that bills had been remitted for arrears of his salary. Is in a very difficult situation owing to lack of funds. Will be obliged to draw on Dr. Franklin for money due Mr. [Francis] Cabarras. Expects Marquis Lafayette to visit the city; will be a great consolation to him. Comments on the treaty with Great Britain and inquires about Dr. [Edward] Bancroft and Mr. [Francis M.] Dana.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Laneuville, Louis Pierre Panot Lombart, chevalier de, 1744-ca.1800

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing two drafts.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing Mr. [Diego] Gardoqui as his particular friend.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting passports for American vessels at Bordeaux, Nantes and I'Orient.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of a plan by which he is to enter as junior partner into a large firm which is to establish a branch house in New England.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing a letter to be delivered to M. d'Aguesseau. The estates [in Grenada] were sequestrated. If [Thomas] Walpole's claims are unjust, he can ruin the estates in three months before the English get possession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing a letter received for Dr. Franklin. Requests cards for Mme. and Mlles. de Villarceaux for a ball to be given by William Temple Franklin.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting an explanation of the 23d Article of the Treaty of Peace regarding the latitude of the Canary Islands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking for information about trade with the United States.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to squirrel skins he has prepared, for making a furcoat.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting passport for the brig "Franklin" and the brigantine "Hazard" bound from Dunkerque to Philadelphia.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has received a box for him; will try to pass it at Calais.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to the purchase of certain articles for him. Remarks on the Treaty of Peace and the political situation in England.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends letter by Mr. [Charles] Storer, to be forwarded to Nantes and St. Germain. Items of news about events in London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to repairs made to a cabriolet.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Accepting his invitation to dinner.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending cambric ruffles made for him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invites him to the dedication of the new temple of the "R. L. du Patriotisme."
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to a passport for their brig "Franklin." Request a list of drugs which would find ready sale in the United States. Offer to sell a newly built vessel, "L'Aigle," of fourteen guns, to Congress.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Assures him that the bill of exchange which he gave him will be paid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending copy of Dr. Franklin's banking account.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to prize-money claimed by the "Alliance" and Commodore [John Paul] Jones's squadron.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Explains his plan for starting in business in America. Refers to trade relations between England and the United States and comments on William Temple Franklin's desire to settle permanently in France. Gives directions for shipping to him a keg of powder.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Refers to receipt of two drafts of Dr. Franklin on Nathaniel Braley and Frederick Buscalier. Remarks on French export commerce to the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to the purchase of a horse for him.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Refers to his visit to Mme. St. Leger; is ignorant of Parisian customs and asks advice how to act. Encloses patterns for frocks for inspection as to the most fashionable one.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends back the carriage by her father.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests him to read the letter he has written to Dr. Franklin and to reply to it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of the visit of Comte d'Estaing and Marquis Lafayette to Madrid; is pleased they were witnesses of his conduct and mode of life. Will soon close his public accounts and send them to Mr. [John] Jay

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Capt. [Gustavus] Cunningham will not sail until the end of the month. Offers to carry the Definitive Treaty to America. Will also take any messages or letters Mr. or Mrs. [John] Jay or Mr.[John] Adams may wish to send by him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Learns that peace was proclaimed by Congress on the 11th and the British King's health drunk at the French Minister's. Peace well received; expectations of a liberal commercial treaty with England. Dr. Franklin's return anxiously awaited by Mr. and Mrs. [Richard] Bache.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting him to a dinner at which Mme. la Marquise Lafayette will be present.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests three of the commemorative medals of American independence, one for the library of the Royal Military School and the other two for Marquis de Timbrune and Baron de Moyria.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Received the three medals and expresses his thanks.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Renews demand for payment of his account.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to a horse he is sending to him.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing Mr. Waring, of South Carolina, who goes to Paris to complete his education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting him to call.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Laneuville, Louis Pierre Panot Lombart, chevalier de, 1744-ca.1800

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to dine.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invites him to call and see his new stock of Valenciennes ruffles, vestcoats, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting that letters for Mrs. Hudson "the Lavaux," an American lady in a convent in this neighborhood, be forwarded for delivery to Barclay, Moylan and Co., of l'Orient.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is about to take passage with Capt. Hoops on the "Nancy" which is ready to sail for Philadelphia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Shipment of four boxes containing various articles for him and Dr. Franklin, Mrs. [John] Jay, Duke de Chaulnes, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing John Paterson, of the firm of William Heines G. Keith and Co., of Ostend.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: As a former school-fellow, introduces and recommends his friend John Paterson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting him to dine at the house of a friend who wishes to show him a machine he has invented.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to send him his keg of powder and order a Marlborough suit for him. Banters him on his hopeless suit for the hand of a certain young lady [Mlle. Brillon].
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is forwarding embroidered handkerchiefs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests a reply to an inquiry from the Prince de Deux-Ponts about trade between certain German States and the United States.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to meet him at the Custom House, to be present at opening of boxes shipped to him from London.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of his arrival at that port and gives his impressions of the Portuguese capital and its people.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Refers to the friendship shown him by Prof. [Jacques Reinhold] Spielmann. Tells of Hoffmann's antecedents and business career.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests a certificate, signed by Dr. Franklin, as to the limits fixed by the Treaty of Peace, to decide the validity of captures at sea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His promise to reward him for service rendered as driver of a hire carriage.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regrets his inability to be present at the celebration in Dr. Franklin' house of the anniversary of American Independence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Refers to the affair of M. de la Ville; is sorry he has done nothing in the matter; asks for the return of the papers in the case.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting a passport for "Mr. Myers, of Amsterdam."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to have a miniature of Dr. Franklin executed by a good artist, for a lady who wishes to wear it in a bracelet, and to send him a lady's watch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hears that the packet "Washington" has arrived at Havre from Philadelphia; wishes to engage passage on her for the return trip. Tells of arrangements he has made for his family in London during his absence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Offers to take charge of any messages, etc., Mr. [John] Jay may have for Martinique.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending his regrets at being unable to accept his invitation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending a sword knot enclosed in a genuine American box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests him to call on Comte de Vergennes, with his memoir and letter from Dr. Franklin, and obtain an "arrèt de sursèance" for him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing a letter for Mme. Brillon to be sent to her return.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Excusing himself for leaving Paris without calling to see him and the ladies at Passy, Mme. Caillot, etc.
In French.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Laneuville, Louis Pierre Panot Lombart, chevalier de. St. Mandé

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires what has become of Mr. [Nathan ?] Blodget and whether Mr. [Henry] Laurens is still in England or has returned to America. Refers to his brother [Normiont de Laneuville]'s return from America.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending a bill of exchange to cover advances made by Dr. Franklin to his brother, Samuel Vaughan [Jr.].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of his arrival at Poole on Capt. [Joshua] Barney's vessel from Havre. Makes inquiry about three bills in favor of Mr. Sherburne, of Boston, on the Commissioners and requests that they be accepted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to his bankruptcy, has found much indulgence and marks of confidence from his creditors. Sends extracts from their letters to be joined to his memoir to Count de Vergennes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Strongly advises him not to continue his suit for the hand of a certain young lady [Mlle. Brillon]; would not be favored by the Brillon family for several reasons. Alludes to Jonathan Williams's business difficulties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Renews his demand for the return of Lady Nicolson's portrait; she has some things belonging to William Temple Franklin which she will send on receipt of her portrait.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Laneuville, Louis Pierre Panot Lombart, chevalier de, 1744-ca.1800

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a French grammar; wishes to have Dr.Franklin's opinion as to whether it would be suitable for use in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests that money belonging to him on deposit with Dr. Franklin be not paid to Tho[ma]s Barclay without his express consent. Will have a claim on the latter of 10,000 livres for cach advances and care of American prisoners.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to his embarrassed affairs. Begs him to do all in his power to obtain an "arrêt de suréance" for him from Comte de Vergennes before September 6th. Encloses a letter (3 p., in French) from A[ugustin] Morice, of Paris, one of his creditors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is about to go to press with his American Almanac; wishes to print a list of the principal officers of the United States. Requests William Temple Franklin to send him some Almanac printed in America containing such a list.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells how an "arrêt de surséance" may be obtained. Refers to the proposed agreement concerning Consuls; thinks the matter should be settled without further delay.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing Loan Office bills for acceptance by the Commissioners.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begs him to make application in his behalf to Comte de Vergennes for protection for his person, furniture, books, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is surprised that Le Ray de Chaumont is opposed to his obtaining a suspension or delay; does not believe he is one of his creditors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiring if any account has been received from the Government Offices concerning his affair.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Not having heard that his "arrèt de sursèance" was granted, he left Nantes to await the decision near Paris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has decided not to appear at Passy or in Paris until his "letters of sursèance" have been granted. Has no apprehension about his person, but wishes to prevent his property from being attached.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks for the costume sent to him and requesting shipment of the keg of powder.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking him to loan one of the anchors at [John D.] schweighauser's of Nantes, to his brother, for the latter's vessel.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Congress is still at Princetown but heartily tired of the place. Thinks they will now return to Philadelphia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is uneasy at not hearing about his "arrêt de surséance".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His judgment was suspended at request of Dr. Franklin. Is now ready with his defense and would like his case to go on and be decided promptly.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: V. and P. French and Nephew

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Have received an order from Jonathan Williams, [Jr.], of Nantes, for 500 bottles of best old claret for Dr. Franklin's use; will ship by first vessel bound for Rouen. Mr. [James ?] Price has gained his suit in Parliament against John Bondfield.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires about the truth of reports from the United States of a revolt in the army, of the retreat of Congress to Princetown, etc. Requests a printed copy of the Treaty of Peace. Tells of war-like preparations and movements by Russia and Turkey.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends explanation of a song. Request that two small balloons be purchased for him and sent to
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Offering a seat in Mme. Foucault's box at the Opera.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanking him for his civilities to Mr. Ewart and Mr. Gower during their stay in Paris; request him to recommend their firm.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: De Tousard, Lt-Col. Louis. Chateau de Villers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending a letter expressing his thanks to Robert Morris for part payment of the pension due him by the United States.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hopes to have the honor of taking a dish of tea with Dr. Franklin on Wednesday morning.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking him to call and see the buckles he is making for him.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His arrival after a perilous passage on the "Nancy", Capt. [Robert] Shewell. Called on Mr. and Mrs. [Richard] Bache. Refers to the arrival of [George] Mason, [Jr.] and ----- Hoops. Is living on Third Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appeals for assistance in his difficulties and certification to the authorities that he is an American citizen and not an important.
(In duplicate.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiring about a work entitled "History of North America since the beginning of the War."
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hears that Dr. Franklin is threatened with a serious illness. Asks when she can see him.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will confer with Dr. Franklin and his grandson (W.T.F.) about the notes furnished for publication to M. de Villon.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The assembling of the Irish Parliament and the political situation in Ireland. Refers to the attitude of [Henry] Grattan and [Henry] Flood. Longs to receive Dr. Franklin but for his study.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has accepted a proposition made by Jonathan Williams, [Jr.] to accompany Mr. [William] Alexander to America. Requests a few letters of introduction to his friends.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves, marquis de, 1757-1834

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thinks the United States should not wait long before treating with France about her commercial interests. Wishes to pave the way to having good measures adopted by the Government; would like to have the opinions of his American friends on the subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Intends to leave for England soon; will dine at Passy before leaving.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends Count Guillaume [de Deux-Ponts]'s thanks for copy of the Definitive Treaty of Peace. Comments on the outbreaks at Philadelphia and the rather hasty departure of Congress. Remarks on the situation in Poland and on the Danube and Russia's seizure of the Crimea, etc. Refers to the illness of Countess Elizabeth, daughter of the Dowager Duchess.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announcement about his stock of new articles of dress for men.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to Dr. Franklin's will, entrusted to his care when in Pennsylvania. Had thought it was destroyed when his country house and property were burned by a mob. Received it lately from New York with some valuable papers saved at the time. Encloses it sealed as when he received it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending buttons, a string for the hat, patterns for waistcoats. Can also give satisfaction for boots, leather breeches, etc., as he has most of the Prince of Wales' workmen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting Mme. [John] Jay and Dr. Franklin to dinner, also M. [Jean Baptiste] Le Roy.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to a package from Mr. [David] Hartley, for Dr. Franklin, which he forwarded from Dover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to a letter to be forwarded to [David] Hartley and a parcel to Mr. [Henry] Grand, at London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trade advertisement received from the Minister of Saxony at Paris, was inserted in papers. Remarks on disinclination of American merchants to form new trade connections. Encloses an order for dry goods to be given to a manufacturer in Saxony or at Hamburg. Inquiry about cloth, linen and silk factories in France.
(In duplicate.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inroducing John Bleakley who is going to Paris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to spend an evening at her house.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledging the receipt of his invitation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to an order for goods from Saxony. Introducing his friend, John Lardner, who is going to Paris.
(In duplicate.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Impromptu song composed on the news, of the occupation of St. Donat by the Emperor of Germany, being received at the French Court. (Notes and corrections by M. Brillon.)
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting passports for himself and Mr. [William] Vernon, [Jr.] who are going to England.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to [squirrel] skins she is sending by Mr. Roker.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Explaining why he has not been able to call on him.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cannot think of any reason for Abby's elopement. Had promised to manumit her on their return to America. Does not believe she can elude the vigilance of the police.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing his cousin, W[illia]m Smith, and Mr. Fitch, of Boston, who are going to Paris.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves, marquis de, 1757-1834

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks for a printed copy of the Declaration of Independence, to have it engraved in gold letters and keep in his cabinet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His trial is to begin next day. Requests him to write to the judges in his favor and testify as to his honesty.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cannot place his friend [Normiont de] Laneuville on an American vessel, none being in port. Warns him that the life on board such vessel is very hard.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begs him and Dr. Franklin to take steps to obtain a settlement of his claims arising from the sale of two vessels seized by him and sold by the French authorities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has been left for several months without official information or instructions from Congress. His situation embarrassing and painful. Alludes to Mr. [John] Jay's unjust attitude towards him; heard that Dr. Franklin even was influenced unfavorably by reports about him. Requests some printed copies of the Constitutions of the States, translated into French, and some commemorative medals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a bill given him by a poor window and asks advice about it. Has some barrels and cases from Mrs. [Richard] Bache for Dr. Franklin. Capt. Jones, who landed in England, brings dispatches from Congress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending the first copy of the new edition of his American Almanac.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests that the accounts of Sabatier and Duprez be sent to him, as he and Mr.[Marthew] Ridley intend to settle them.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a letter from his client, [John] S[c]haffer, an American, in prison. Recommends his request to Dr. Franklin for pecuniary assistance.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is sick in prison; begs Dr. Franklin to send him some money for his subsistence.
In French.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: MacMahon, John. At the Military school in Paris

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a letter written by M. Nanty, of Nantes, to George Woulfe. Explained the affair to Dr. Franklin several months ago. Asks what reply he should make to Mr. Woulfe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of the fashions in dress for men; the women in England are beautiful and dress well. Requests letters of introduction to prominent people in English society.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: V. and P. French and Nephew

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Have shipped to Rouen, for Dr. Franklin, eight cases of old claret wine and enclose bill for same.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to his claim arising from the sale of the privateer "Terrible," at Guadeloupe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Refers to the political state of affairs in England. Is glad that New York is at last evacuated. Encloses a letter for Mrs. [John] Jay.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will bring some of the biscuit desired on his next voyage. Hopes that the barrels and boxes of seed for Dr. Franklin arrived in good condition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending power of attorney to be legalized. Encloses a letter from Capt. John Paul Jones who is on board the French ship "Triomphant" in West Indian waters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks for some copies of a map.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking him, if possible, to get a pass for his ship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks to be pardoned for not waiting on Benjamin Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An invitation to dinner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a package of letters for l'Orient; has directed that all his letters be sent in care of Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The credit will be satisfied on Saturday, from what he understood from Mr. [John] Jay.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ask for a letter of introduction, from Benjamin Franklin to friends in America, for Count Del Messe [Le Comte Del Verme] a great Nobleman of Italy. Mr. Caccia, the banker, has requested him to obtain this.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Would return the cabriolet immediately but the wheels are shabby; awaits his orders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wishes to know the value of dollars in French money, as fixed by Congress for the payment of their Minister's salaries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests him to write to M. [Jean Charles Pierre] Lenoir, Lieutenant de Police, to obtain Abby's release from confinement, as she is ill.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a letter from Marquis Lafayette to Baron de Wurmser and his own remarks on the subject; will write to Mr. [Henry] Laurens soon.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has been promoted to the rank of Lieut-Col. by the King. Sends testimonials which he received for his services in the United States from Congress, Gen. Washington and Gen. Gates, and requests that they be certified to by Dr. Franklin.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks if William Temple Franklin can take him in his carriage to M. de St. Olympe's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Apologizes for not answering his invitation sooner; le Chevalier de Chastellux will bring him, Mr. Marmontel has another engagement.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invites him to assist at a Masonic festival.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: M. [Billardon] de Sauvigny, Royal Censor and author of "Gabrielle d'Estrées" has written a drama ("Agile") on the War in America; before its production the author wishes to read it to Dr. Franklin and his friends, and requests a time to be appointed.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks him to beg his Excellency [Dr. Franklin] not to forget his interest while he (Putnam) is away.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Feels that Mr. [Matthew] Ridley must have failed in assistance or met with obstacles; he will stay where he is until the Court has decided his case.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks for an appointment for some information about land in North America.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks him for the letter enclosing 12 louis from his Excellency [Dr. Franklin]; cannot get out of prison without his Excellency's help, aks William Temple Franklin to call on him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks him to call on him in the Temple as it is not far from Madame Depire.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has given all the papers received from his Excellency [Dr. Franklin] to an interpreter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will return the papers with his remarks thereon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks him for the enclosed medal; would like an order to get some in silver and copper; he leaves that evening; offers to do anything he may be asked to do by Dr. Franklin and William Temple Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mr. [David] Hartley is expected every hour; wishes a copy of commercial article No. 4 of the Provisional Treaty.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanking him and Dr. Franklin for their offer of an apartment for his uncle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expressing gratitude for the services of Dr. Franklin in his behalf.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request for assistance in temporary financial embarrassment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Declining an invitation to tea.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Price of mourning buckles, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanking him for a copy of the "Constitutions of the United States of America"; will call to see him with Chevalier Duplessis de Mauduit.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Apologizing for a misunderstanding.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking for part payment for carriage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A request to forward letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to forward a packet. Gossip on Royal affairs.
In French.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Laneuville, Louis Pierre Panot Lombart, chevalier de, 1744-ca.1800

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to have Dr. Franklin certify to the genuineness of letters of M. Golker.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation for Monday evening.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Franklin to recommend his hotel to friends in Philadelphia.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledging receipt of his billet, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning a suitable English publisher for one of his books.
In French.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: V. and P. French and Nephew

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledges receipt of payment of account. Inquires if Bayonne is to be a free port for Americans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning an "L. S." and an "S. C." which he has promised to procure for him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Containing news of friends and acquaintances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting the return of his papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledges receipt of power of attorney. Other personal items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging Franklin's intervention with the Marquis Lafayette in behalf of Mr. [John] Schaffer.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regarding a coat a pins which have been delayed. Discusses contest between [Charles James] Fox, [Sir] Cecil Wray and Lord [Samuel] Hood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledges courtesies shown his friend Mr. Ewart; writes in behalf of latter, regarding the Consulship at Barcelona, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledge remittance from Robert Morris for copying machine for Mr. [Thomas] Jefferson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending a card requested by Mr. [John] Jay.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A request to forward a letter to [Joseph Matthias Gérard] de Rayneval.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Changing the date for a dinner engagement.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to a great coat and six (scarf) pins he is sending him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expressing his regrets that he is obliged to leave immediately for Switzerland, owing to the serious state of his health, without being able to call on him. Will always treasure the book of the "Constitutions" as a souvenir from a descendant of the great Benjamin Franklin.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting a letter of recommendation for a friend.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting a letter of introduction to some gentlemen at St. Cloud; and the loan of some pamphlets on the Aerostatic Globe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a memoir of his claim against Capt. Mainvielle, of Charlestown, South Carolina, with request that it be laid before the authorities of that State.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking a word of approval, to accompany some wine to be sent to Mr. [Richard] Bache.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning the functions of a Consul.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thinks it would be more consistent for him not to appear at Court, when the Act of Congress is presented authorizing him to accept the Order of Military Merit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Discontinues lessons an account of ill-health.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting an order to have a piece of goods delivered to him for Madame [Le Ray] de Chaumont.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning [Le Ray] de Chaumont's accounts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Writes to him of Dr. [Edward] Bancroft; the marriage of [François] Barbé de Marbois; the adventures of "Chevalier de Longchamps."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Presenting a portrait of Le Marquis Lafayette.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter about various members of the family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has forwarded the letter to John Holker.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: ----- Revière, Chargé des Affaires of Saxony

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to forward a letter to Philadelphia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Suggests remedy for rash; gives commission to purchase handkerchiefs, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks to have his accounts, as settled, deposited in the Consul's office for public inspection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to have his papers certified by Dr. Franklin, so that he may present them to Marquis de Castries.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Gov. [William] Franklin has been in Sussex for the benefit of the seabathing; now back in London; at one time he had an intention of visiting Passy. Some time ago Mr. [Benjamin] West, having the opportunity of seeing three of the American Plenipo [tentiarie]s here and wishing to transmit their portraits to posterity in some historical picture, made a sketch of the signing of the Preliminary Treaty, to which he contributed by lending his portrait of Dr. Franklin by [Joseph] Wright, which be brought with him from Paris. There is only wanting (to make it complete) a head of the Secretary to the American Commission, which Mr. West requests you will send us. He has promised the portrait of Dr. Franklin, when Mr. West can spare it, to Mrs. [William] Hewson who, from her long acquaintance and great veneration for him, he thought highly deserving of such a present. He reserves a copy of it for himself and has given one to Mr. [William] Strahan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An invitation to a meeting. Printed.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Going to dine with Mme. Helvétius on Wednesday. Will see him at Passy if he does not leave before then. Requests him to loan her his carriage horses.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiring where a "perfect drawing of the American Order of Cincinnatus" can be obtained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledges, with thanks, the information regarding the Order of Cincinnatus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regarding letters sent in their care for Mr. Sumners.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning the purchase of a coat.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soliciting aid in obtaining a Royal permit to marry a Catholic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing bills for examination.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a letter from Abbé Belin and recommends him as a teacher of French, Italian, Latin, etc.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends letters to be forwarded to friends in North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiring about an "affair" at the Palais Royal in which Mr. [David Salisbury] Franks was concerned.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recalls their acquaintance at Lady Nicolson's. Wishes to have an interview with him about a prelate who desires to go to America to be of service to the Catholics in that country.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Giving an account of books he has written, etc. Inquires about an English professorship in Paris.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recommending a servant.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A business announcement.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request him to get an order form the Minister to let his baggage and furniture pass, which he is shipping to England and America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks him for getting him the lodgings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning the attachments at Nantes and l'Orient. The last letter he delivered to M. de Vergennes from Dr. Franklin was so clear, he thought the affair would end in a few days. Sent to the Marèchal de Castries the papers he wished to see relative to the seizure at

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announcing the birth of a son.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to discharge his account.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends him lace ruffles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Refers to Dr. Franklin's malady [stone in the bladder]. Recommends a litter drawn by two mules, as the best conveyance in his case. Tells of Mr. [John] Adams's departure and his intention to rejoin Dr. Franklin and Mr. [Thomas] Jefferson at Paris.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a letter for Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting him to take charge of two letters for delivery on his arrival in London.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Understands French imperfectly; asks him to fix his servants' compensation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Giving information regarding London-lodgings, tradesmen, places of interest, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing a letter for Baron de Nolken.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Items of news about Dr. Franklin's and [Louis Guillaume] Le Veillard's health. Comments on the report of the Commissioners on Mesmerism. Mesmer not apparently affected by it.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of having gone to see his injured horse; dined at Mr. [Thomas] Barclay's.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to stay at his house while in London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledging the introduction of M. de Jauge.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Refers to Mesmer's petition for a new commission to examine his discoveries.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranging for visits and sight-seeing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His opinion of [Mlle.] B[rillion]'s change of manner towards William Temple Franklin; comments on the new employment proposed to the latter. Tells of his love affairs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regarding repairs to his carriage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of new books on political matters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to dinnner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Would have him meet Mrs. Dorothy Blunt and Mrs. [Mary] Hewson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of Dr. Franklin's health and of his having dined on two occasions at Auteuil. Refers to proposed ascent of the Robert's balloon. A new commission appointed to investigate Mesmer's theories. Arrival of John Jay and [Henry] Laurens in America.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks for news of Marquis Lafayette; requests letters to be forwarded, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Making an appointment to introduce his nephew.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of [Comte de] Mirabeau being in London, after having lost the lawsuit with his wife; of the return of the Brillon family. The Dauphin has left Passy, much benefited by the new springs there. Describes the ascent of the Mm. Robert in the Duke of Chartres's baloon. M. and Mme. Caillot are leaving Passy to live at St. Germain.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to the play.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mme. [Mariamne] Williams and other members of her family are staying with Dr. Franklin. Tells of reports about the Robert's balloon. M. [Louis Guillaume] Le Veillard still ill.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Making an appointment to go with him to Windsor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An invitation to tea for himself and [Comte de] Mirabeau.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Shipley, Jonathan, Bishop of St. Asaph. Chilbolton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invites William Temple Franklin to spend a few days in the country as he cannot go to London.
(In duplicate.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telling of his trip through Holland and from there to England; is delighted with everything he has seen in England. Will endeavor to get introduced to Governor William Franklin on his return to London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His ship, "Marianne," will sail for Norfolk, Virginia, in about ten days. Will be pleased to execute any commands that he may give.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of the visit of Prince Henry [of Prussia], accompained by Marèchal de Biron, to Dr. Franklin. Refers to Abbè Morellet's trip to London with Lord Fitzmaurice.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Informs him that the portraits were sent to him by Abbè Morellet.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a pamphlet. Regrets his inability, owing to Mrs. Price's illness, to show him attention while in London, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing Mr. [William] Godwin, who wishes information on Animal Magnetism, as he is translating the Commissioners' Report. Arranges for visits to various houses in London.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Shipley, Jonathan, Bishop of St. Asaph. Chilbolton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regrets not having seen [William Temple] Franklin at his house. Suggests the purchase of the account of the Dean of St. Asaph's Trial for Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ordering the purchase of a bound edition of Tristram Shandy. An epigram in French on Animal Magnetism sent to Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of the purchase of the St. Cloud property by the Queen; an immense balloon has been made in which the public will be allowed to go up on paying a fee. The Mesmer affairs dying out.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has procured a Newfoundland pup. Awaits his orders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Gives addresses where cast iron coverings, pistols, etc., can be had. Declined invitation to Bowood and Chilbolton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An invitation to dinner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hopes to see him at her house. Requests that he take for her a parcel of books for B[enjamin] F[ranklin] Bache.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Gladto hear of the prolongation of his visit. Hopes to see him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regarding the payment of a claim made by William Temple Franklin and the investment of the same in shares of the Bank.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rumors of Dr. Franklin's recall. Advises William Temple Franklin to make friends for himself. Warns him that the persons he sees most of are his enemies. Marquis Lafayette's exertions in behalf of Dr. Franklin are injurious to the latter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing Madame de Villeneuve.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has not heard from his parents or Mme. Helvètius since his arrival. Lord Fitzmaurice regrets William Temple Franklin cannot go to Bowood. Encloses some letters for friends in Paris.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks for an appointment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is waiting to hear the date of his departure from London; wishes to go with him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasure derived from his short visit at Chilbolton; wishes to have it repeated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends pamphlets which he requests him to deliver in Paris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends cards of admission to Guildhall; advises full dress for the occasion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Commission to buy dress coat, buckles, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends two copies of "Letter A in English, French and Latin" one for Benjamin Franklin and one for Count d'Adhemar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a model of his "phiz" for Dr. Franklin; thinks it will travel safely. Hopes to receive one of the latter in return.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranges for a visit from him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to deliver a parcel to Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a letter for Dr. Franklin. Asks for the loan of [Jacques] Turgot's "National Riches." Money matters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells him how to reach them; asks him to bring Mrs. Barbauld's "Lessons for Children" and "Sanford and Merton."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends money due. Hopes horse will prove satisfactory.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing account of payments, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This comes of his not keeping his appointment. Writes by same post to Dover to learn of his whereabouts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Prices of locket for Comte d'Artois, and other purchases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announcing the birth of a daughter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing a letter for Mr. Nath[anie]l Tracy. Dr.[John] Jeffries ascends with M. [François] Blanchard next week.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has been detained by bad weather. Hopes to bring the horse and dog safely to Passy within a week.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledges receipt of waistcoats. Inquires about dress coat, etc. Beauties of Bath.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests the loan of a book by Mr. [Richard] Price on the "Constitution of the United States" in which is to be found a letter, in French, by [Jacques] Turgot.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His opinion of the wine sent by Baron De Feriet. Cannot expect much from Congress with regard to application made by Dr. Franklin in behalf of William Temple Franklin. Disposition of funds received from Robert Morris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a letter by Dr. [John] Jeffries's balloon from Dover; glad to hear of his son's safe arrival in Paris, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will be glad to have a room at Passy for the winter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires about a pension or college for two young boys.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: At this instant there is an accommodation on foot between Mr. [Alexander John] Alexander and Mr.[Thomas] Walpole and the Commissioners of both sides have had one meeting and apparently have equal dispositions for peace. But at this instant Walpole is taking advantage of the security which Mr. Alexander supposes himself in, and is secretly endeavoring to take his person here. This is somethings worse than what the Devil himself would do. The object, therefore, is for Mr. Alexander to go to Ostend in the most private way possible, but they have good information that he is so watched that he would be taken on the way were he to go openly. Requests him, therefore, to fill up a passport for "John Brown allant à Ostende" which he thinks the Doctor [Franklin] will, without hesitation, sign. Gives minute instructions for the engagement of a place on the coach for Ostend for John Brown. Let it be said at the diligence that Mr. Brown is at St. Denis and will join it there.

E. by A[lexander] J[ohn] A[lexander]. Request that the bearer may be kept until he is sent back with the ticket for the diligence and the passport, with advice as to the most convenient place to go to join the diligence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends printing press ordered.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announces his arrival in England. Willingness to execute commissions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begs his interest in his affairs with de Colonia, their "Rapporteur."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting him to take charge of packets on his return journey to Paris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires if he can accept Mrs. [William] Hodgson's invitation to go to her country house.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An invitation to dinner.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to dinner.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Declines an invitation.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of her long walk to their meeting-place and her distress at having to wait there and come back alone.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sorry to have missed his call; hopes to see him before he leaves England.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to balloons and gas for filling them, which he has for sale.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petition to obtain payment of his claim against J[ohn] S[c]haffer, an American, for food and clothing furnished to the latter.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends Dr. Franklin's account; asks for a commemorative medal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to call at her house.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Informing him that Mrs. [Richard] Price has suffered a stroke of paralysis and her husband cannot receive them. Expects to go to Batl to see Lord Shelburne.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells of his journey and arrival in England. Went immediately to Bowood with Lord Fitzmaurice. Wishes to know when he proposes to return to France.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: At a special meeting it was decided that the dedication of Dr. Franklin's bust should take place on the 18th, that the ceremony should not be too solemn, and that each member, whether present or absent, should be taxed 9 livres.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting Governor [William] Franklin and William Temple Franklin to a card party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Quoting prices of English books he has for sale.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Would like Mr. [Jonathan] Williams, [Jr.] to recommend him to some one who would sell his prints on commission in America.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting him to dinner to meet the Dean of St. Asaph and Mrs. Shipley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Accepting invitation to dine with Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thinks it will be well for him to go unattended to Mrs. [Mary] Hewson's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks for a passport for the types.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has invited Mr. Vernon, and Englishman of good family, his brother-in-law, Mr. Dawson, and Mr. Arthur to dine with William Temple Franklin; requests the latter to invite [John Paul] Jones.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anxious inquiries about Dr. Franklin's health. Introduces a friend. Petition of New York Tories to King of England, and discontent of Tories in London, conducive to peace. Society for Constitutional Information; happy to find the honest Englishmen grown wise by experiences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a draft on Paris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Postponing the date for a concert.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires about wines in Mr. [John] Bondfield's account with the public, purchased for account of Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to dinner.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledges receipt of buckles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledging the courtesies and attentions he received during his stay in Paris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has just learned that M. [Jean Antoine] Houdon has been commissioned by Congress to make two statues. Is dissappointed at having been passed over, after having made Dr. Franklin's portrait and executed Gen. [Richard] Montgomery's tomb, without any charge or compensation whatever. Franklin and his son had both promised to recommend him to Congress. Still hopes they will interest themselves in his favor.
(In French. In duplicate.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Money affairs. Packet for Mr. Henry Grand. Sends parcel of books for Dr. Franklin. Writing machine for Mr. [Thomas] Jefferson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking for a loan of money.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting letters of introduction to the Governors of Martinique and Tobago for Mr. William Manning, [Jr.].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires whether his letter with enclosures to Jonathan Williams, [Jr.,] Samuel Wharton and Samuel Lewis Wharton, at Phildelphia, have been received.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regarding the sale of his carriage.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves, marquis de, 1757-1834

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has received several letters from America. Learns that Congress has reassembled at New York; delegates from Vermont have arrived with credentials; General Washington writes from Annapolis, of negotiations he is conducting for opening the Potomac to navigation.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing Mr. Randall. Offering services for commissions in New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Agrees to purchase his horse.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wrote last month about the report that M. [Jean Antoine] Houdon had been commissioned by Congress to make two statues, in spite of the writer's former services and the promises made to him. Requests a definite reply on the subject.
(In French. In duplicate.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a case for Mr. [Thomas] Jefferson; also letters concerning the disagreeable affair of Samuel Wharton, with his house. Personal details.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soliciting an appointment for his son, as Vice-Consul at Dieppe.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves, marquis de, 1757-1834

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks if M. [Le Ray] de Chaumont [fils], who is going to America, will take as his servant, an Englishman who is recommended to him by the Duchesse de Lauzun.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledges receipt of pamphlet. Rumors of negotiations for Commercial Treaty. His Parliamentary application in a good way to succeed. Introduces Dr. [Thomas] Ruston.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has written to him twice without receiving any reply. Surprised at this, as he has always received a reply even when writing to Ministers, Princes and the highest Lords of the Court. Has, nevertheless, complied with his request, made through M. Lair de Lamotte, and delivered the plaster bust of Dr. Franklin to Delorme, to be packed and shipped by the latter. Encloses the bill for making the bust, packing, etc.
(In French. Copy.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Instructions how to send his coat, in order to escape Custom Home duties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cause of delay in sending the case of china. Goes to Paris to settle the public accounts. Bill for tea and china for Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Declares his only object in executing a bust of Dr. Franklin was to transmit the portrait of a great man to posterity. Only received his actual expenses for the monument to Gen. [Richard] Montgomery. Claims he was entitled to more consideration for the above reasons, from Dr. Franklin and his grandson.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His book and subscriptions for the same.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recalls his application for letters of introduction for his brother-in-law, W[illia]m Manning, Jr. Apologizes for letters of introduction given to Mr. Perry and Mr. Long. Dr. P[riestley]'s work on "Evidence of the Fathers respecting the Nature of Jesus Christ.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Number of French officers in London. See Dr. [Edward] Bancroft.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Making an appointment to explain the regulations of the Sociérté de l'Harmonie.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regarding the sale of his carriage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses a letter to M. [Charles Alexandre] de Calonne; payment of fine by latter. Rumor that the freedom of l'Orient is to be transferred to Havre.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to meet a committee of the Société de l'Harmonie and pass upon Rules and Regulations.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing Benjamin Chew, of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests to be recommended professinally to Mr. [John] Adams and family. Asks advice in the matter of Blanchard and aerial experiments. Blanchard's indebtedness to him and disposition to tax him to the utmost.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Voyage to England and expenses of the same. Dr. [Richard] Price will give the list of books for Franklin Township. He advises against the use of solvents in Dr. Franklin's illness.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has received his letter for Chevalier MacEgan, Captain in the Berwick Regiment, but has been unable to discover his whereabouts; the Regiment is in garrison at Isle de Ré.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning the price of a press.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires about the price of his horse, and when it can be seen.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thinks Dr. Franklin could not do better than go to America in the June packet; hopes to join him at Havre.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires about Dr. Franklin's health. Wishes to buy his cabriolet.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to a case of goods for Henry Grand, in England.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Makes an appointment to call on him. Hopes the painting he is going to make of his horse will be worthy of his acceptance.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recent books on French architecture.
(Nn French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rumors of his intention to leave Paris. Sends specimen of type; hopes to receive recommendations to friends in America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is exceedingly sorry to hear that he and Dr. Franklin are going to return to America. Mr. [John] Adams is about to go to St. James's for the first time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reply to his inquiry about a work published on French architecture containing plans of houses and hotels of Paris. etc.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Design for a seal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to secure the sanction of Baron de Breteuil, or Duc de Chartres to accompany M. [Jean François] Pilâtre de Rozier on a balloon trip from France to England.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Accepts a commission to purchase harness. Asks for use of a jockey to try his horse. Invitation to dinner.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to a musicale.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has searched unsuccessfully for the book on "Solvents for the Stone," requested by Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Embarrassed for want of funds to discharge the debt due him.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Offers to enter Franklin's service, if his son be also employed.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begs for a loan of money to discharge his debts and leave Paris for America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranging for a suitable vessel for Dr. Franklin's voyage to America. Meréchal de Castries says if he can wait a little, such a King's ship shall be ordered as will give him every possible convenience.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Information of the arrival of Captain Nicholson's vessel in which Dr. Franklin wishes to take passage for America. Offers rooms at his house for Dr. Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has been employed, professionally, by Mr. [John] Adams's family. Sends an account of his aerial experiments. Asks for suggestions and corrections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends good wishes for his voyage to America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arrangements for transferring the 129 pieces of baggage from the boat to the sailing vessel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to a proposal to exchange some books with William Temple Franklin or Dr. Franklin. Asks if there is no key for the printing press he bought from the latter.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Apologizes for interrupting his preparations for the voyage; begs him not to forget the printing and prompt distribution in Canada, of the manuscript which he gave him; desires his and his grandfather's influence with Parliament on the subject of his seigniories on Lake Champlain. Encloses his manuscript concerning the formation of the Assembly in the Province of Quebec. [17p.]
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter from his son in America. Advice and good wishes for their voyage.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The disposition of the furniture left in Dr. Franklin's house. Encloses several accounts. Will always remember, with gratitude, the time spent with Dr. Franklin—his benefactor; always admired William Temple Franklin's attachment for his grandfather. Hopes to obtain, later, employment in America.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanking him for taking charge of his letters for America and wishing him a speedy and safe arrival.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends good wishes for his voyage. Offers his services for commissions, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends by M. [Jean Antoine] Houdon, who sets out this evening, a letter for his brother. Good wishes for thier voyage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encloses letters for friends in Philadelphia. Good wishes for their voyage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bids adieu to him on his departure and begs him not to forget him. Warns him against a too great ambition.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Terms for freight, etc., from Masters of two different vessels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires at what time the porters shall call with the chaise.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will place the sum of money to his credit as soon as he receives it from ----- -----.
In French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
